review: I have had my Fire TV for several months now.  I did not want to write a review until I had put some miles on it.  Simply stated, great streamer, and so much more.  I'm looking at getting a second one. I would do 4.5 stars if I could only because of launcher / xbmc (Kodi) issue.Pros:Plenty of horsepower to run streaming mediaSideloading apps is simple (if you've done it on other devices).  There's a great tutorial on XBMC's (now Kodi) web site.  Do a web search, you will easily find it.Many apps (and more coming all the time)music streaming (with new prime music, it replaces Pandora for me)Runs XBMC well, without breaking a sweat, remote control works "natively"USB Keyboard/mouse easily attach and useful.XBOX USB dongle makes XBOX controls useable as game controllers.Android Remote app works like "native" remote (needed after I lost original remote).Voice search (kinda cool)Optical outConsAccess to sideloaded apps is difficult (either go though system settings - applications - PIN - manage apps - select app - launch ; or use a piggyback approach - search it, plenty of tutorials out there).Does not support "Universal" remote - namely Harmony - without jumping so many hoops that I simply decided to give up (you need to add support for WMC remote, essentially).No native browser (you can sideload Firefox)Voice search (Amazon content and Vivo, all others be da..ed)Having previously had a roku, this device is a world apart, and then some.  Quality of picture / sound are great. Endless apps, games, etc. It is not a game console replacement for intense gaming, but great fun for casual stuff.  I tried the Ouya before, but returned it, as I couldn't get it to sync with TV + Receiver. This thing had 0 issues in any configuration (HDMI to TV, Optical to Receiver ; HDMI to Receiver to TV;)I think Amazon built a great device.  It replaced my HTPC as it is smaller, simpler, runs cooler, draws less power, gives me every option I want, and can frankly do more.
